answer: <p>American currency can easily be represented with dollar and cent amounts.  Integers are 100% precise, while floating point binary numbers do not exactly match floating point decimals.</p>
rows.title: Why not use Double or Float to represent currency?
rows.content:
<p>I've always been told <em>never</em> to represent money with <code>double</code> or <code>float</code> types, and this time I pose the question to you: why? </p>

<p>I'm sure there is a very good reason, I simply do not know what it is.</p>
